bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, WESTERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the application of Wah Ni for a Writ of Habeas Corpus United States of America, Plaintiff vs Wah Ni, Defendant.
State of Washington, County of Pierce
Thomas Hawks being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says:

That he is and has been for a num ber of years last past a citizen and resident and freeholder of the city of Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon and was for a number of yyears deputy sheriff and a member of the police force of said city, and has for three years last past been deputy city tax collector engaged in the collecting of taxes in said city; that he is the identical person who signed as Captain Thomas Hawks the statement in the foregoing exhibit "A" attached to the certificate of Wah Ni as ac- knowledged on the 11th day of January, A. D., 1892 before J. E. Marks Notary Public; that he is well and personally acquainted with said Wah Ni, and has, at different times, collected taxes of him and called at his said place of business which is 254 Morri- son street; that the said Wah Ni is a member of the firm of Yee Wah & Co., dealers in Chinese merchandise at said number in Port- land; and deponent further says that owing to the fact that he was assigned, in the performance of his duties both as policeman and tax collector, to the district occupied by the Chinese, he has at different times been called upon to sign statements for Chinamen who were intending to go to China and return to the United States; and deponent further says that he is duly informed and verily be- lieves that the said Wah Ni is a member of said firm of Yee Wah & Co., deponent having at various times seen said Wah Ni engaged

in working about and employed in said place of business of said firm in Portland, and deponent has examined the original of said certificates and knows the contents thereof and says that each and every statement therein contained is true to the best knowledge and belief of deponent; and deponent further says that said Wah Ni did depart andgo to China at and about the time of hisobtain- ing said certificate and that he verily believes that he went there for the sole purpose offurther aiding and assisting in the carrying on of said business of said firm as aforesaid as repres- ented by said Wah Ni in said certificate, and deponent verily be- lieves that said Wah Ni is a good, respectable and bona fide Chinese merchant of the United States and has been for three of more years last past, deponent stating upon oath that he has known him for at least that long including the period of said absence from the United States and deponent i s duly informed and verily be- lieves that at this time he has an interest in and is one of the joint owners of the business as carried on by said firm and is a good, honest, upright and bone afide fide Chinese merchant ast aforesaid.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 6th day of June, 1893
Notary Public in and for Pierce County, Residing at Tacoma, Washington.
